    Stopping (killing) a server instance

    Note: All of the content on this site is under construction. I am mostly working on theme development instead of documentation, so much of the content is acting as filler right now.

    If the Jekyll server won't stop running, but you can't stop it by pressing Ctrl+C, do this:

    1. Find the PD by typing ps aux | grep jekyll. Look for a number such as 22298.
    2. Type kill -9 22298 where "1234" is the PID.

    killall ruby

    Site last generated: Feb 20, 2015. Built with Jekyll using the Jekyll-doc theme.
